website_summaries.verdict: While it won’t reach the magnification range of larger spotting scopes, its light weight and low price make it a good choice for a backup or budget scope.
pros: Lightweight and easy to carry and use
Focuses well past 100 yards with a wide field of view, and picks up detail at 50-75 yards, which is good for pistol range target checking
cons: Carrying case is thin and not padded
Lens can dislodge if monocular is dropped

website_summaries.verdict: Compact, durable, and easy to grip, this is a great monocular for travel, birding, spectator sports, concerts, or enjoying scenery.
pros: Wide-view lens lets you take in panoramic landscapes at a glance
Molded, nonslip grip cuts down on shakiness
cons: Some customers say they want more magnification

customer_reviews.title: Useless - Almost no magnification
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item based solely on the high rating from so many people appeared to have given it. I should have stuck to my search based on performance specifications. This scope has almost no magnification at all, and has such a small exit pupil that moving it just a gnat's hair off center causes the view to black out. There's a reason there are no hard specifications on this product. I returned the Roxant and ponied up the extra $30 for a Polaris Optics Titan 12x50, and I'm extremely happy with that. It has 12x magnification, and a big enough front lens that the view is bright without blacking out when you move it slightly.
customer_reviews.author: Donnaster

customer_reviews.title: No Magnification
customer_reviews.text: I really can't believe it, but I received this scope yesterday and tested it out. It has almost zero magnification. I looked through the scope a couple dozen times in various tests to make sure what I was seeing through the scope was the same thing I saw with my naked eyes, and is was the same...maybe, possibly it could have .5 mag, but certainly no more. I am just now packing it up and sending it back. Given what many other reviewers have reported, I should have just passed on this scope. On the positive side, though, it looks nice, has great hand-feel and a really nice eyepiece. Just no magnification that I can discern. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can't get a clear view left and right , end up with returned it. it's over priced for sure. After I posted a one star review,the seller sent me total three nasty accusing emails , BUYERS BE AWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Roxant Grip Scope. The design is simple and functional and it fits my hand very comfortably. It feels like a top quality item and based on all the other products I looked at before deciding on this one the price is very reasonable. I bought this mainly for birdwatching. I can see every detail on the birds through the crystal clear lens of this scope. I have a desk next to my living room window and the scope sits right next to my computer ready for action. This scope has a very small foot print and a very big joy factor!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Monocular. Works excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a monocular scope for bird watching during visits to various parks in the summer. Found this roxant scope on amazon so I ordered the same. Amazon delivered it very quickly during this COVID 19 lockdown season. I opened it and checked the same. Found roxant scope very sturdy. MY daughter dropped it twice already but it’s completely safe and shockproof. We are looking forward to use this scope during upcoming spring and summer time. The customer support team is amazing on followup . Stay safe and Stay healthy.
customer_reviews.author: DOLPHY

customer_reviews.title: For the money, the magnification is still underpowered
customer_reviews.text: As others have indicated, the magnification is rather disappointing. I wanted something to help me spot my progress at the 100 yard shooting range without breaking the bank on those grossly expensive spotter scopes. This product may be cheaper, but I would not consider it cheap to buy. My $15 pair of binoculars that I used in Boy Scouts had much better magnification. As a positive, the wide view lense is a nice touch. You don’t have to press your eye into the product to see through it like you would with a pair of binoculars. I just don’t think the magnification power is worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Paine

customer_reviews.title: Did not like what I saw
customer_reviews.text: Mine came in the mail broken. The glass inside had detached from the body in transit. It looked like it was being held in by a two small black glue or resin spots along the sides of the glass. Returned for refund, and decided to go for another monocular because I didn't like what I saw.
customer_reviews.author: johnnybegood

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Value!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love the new grip scope I purchased through Amazon! The Roxant Grip Scope is a great value for the quality of the product. It is simple, well built and easy to use. I especially like the eyeglass piece for easy adjustment. I primarily use this scope for bird watching but it sure comes in handy for checking things out down the street! What I like best is that it is compact. Things that I want to see often aren’t in one place for too long so a small powerful scope is super useful to pop open and gander! Thanks so much for the quality and the price of this powerful hand held scope!
customer_reviews.author: Zoognut

customer_reviews.title: Great quaility  but...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return item. I felt really bad about it. It was a Christmas present. I could not see that well just using one eye. I could not focus on the target for very long. I do not have this problem with my rifles with scopes on them. I shoot with a scope just fine. But I had such a hard time using this I returned it and got a pair of compact binoculars instead. They are much easier for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: My Grip Scope came very quickly and well-packaged with no damage. I ordered it for my partner who lives in Canada where Amazon shipping charges are exorbitant. He asked for this model specifically. He thought it would be very handy to use one-handed and quickly for bird-watching. Also, he’s very interested in astronomy and when no telescope is handy, or when a telescope won’t find a specific body in space, it helps to be able to find it with a smaller lens first. He and I like that it’s sturdy, not slippery and has good optics. I have tried it out and found this to be the case. I thought the price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: jrreader

customer_reviews.title: Very good product purchased two
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the roxant grip scope. I purchased two of them for the holidays one for my brother who is a hunter and has been requesting a good scope and my father in law who works in HVAC and is having trouble viewing small parts and SN#’s etc.. The package arrived in 2 days as promised and feels like quality. I live on a golf course and was able to see for what seemed like miles with crystal clear clarity.
customer_reviews.author: JHP

customer_reviews.title: This company stands behind its quality, low-cost monocular!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive the Roxant Grip Scope so quickly so that I can use it for my upcoming camping trip for bird-watching! I've already used it to better visualize a rally held at my local post office this morning from my across the street 3rd floor apartment. I was able to read all of the signage very clearly. The non-extended eyepiece worked well for me, as I wear glasses. I'm very excited to use the scope at concerts (when they are once again live, rather than virtual!) The scope's lightweight, size, strap, case, extended warranty, clear instructions, and promise of support mean a lot to me.
customer_reviews.author: Gerri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backyard bird watching product
customer_reviews.text: I recently received the Grip Monocular and love it! My husband and I have become bird watchers and can now see the details on the birds visiting our feeders. The clarity is sharp, the adjustments are easy to use, the monocular feels solid and comfortable to hold. We’re enjoying the wide view. The price is reasonable. Delivery was fast. The product and packaging in perfect shape. Although I purchased it for backyard birdwatching I will use it for hiking as well, travel and concerts (when they can start up again). I’ve always had difficulty using binoculars, the monocular design is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Powell

customer_reviews.title: A Good Scope for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I like the size for my purposes which is watching animals in my backyard and when I go hiking. What attracted me to the scope was the size and shape which makes it easy to handle one handed with our shaking. I also like the fact that I can use while wearing my glasses. I really can’t think of anything I could suggest that would improve the quality and finally the price was right’ I would recommend this scope to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Schuh

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with my purchase. It feels solid and well built. It isn’t heavy though. I love it. Until a week ago I never knew monoculars existed and honestly best thing ever. Small and compact with the wide view is great. It is small and compact and will fit easily almost anywhere. Fits nicely in my hand. Price is very reasonable. I did a lot of research and comment reading before I decided on my purchase. Will be using it for canoe trips down the river and my husband will probably take it ice fishing with him It was delivered in perfect condition. Wrapped tightly and securely. The packaging was very nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: beanstone

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my mom who is 92
customer_reviews.text: My mom wanted a monocular for viewing birds and other activities around the farm. I reviewed dozens of monoculars, and decided on the Roxant Grip Scope for the following reasons: 1. The good reviews, 2. wide field of view, 3. not too powerful, 4. overall design, and 5. not too expensive. My mom received the monocular and likes it. I mentioned the need to exercise the focusing ring when new to make focusing easy (per instructions). In summary this monocular is very easy to use, is of excellent construction, has excellent optics, and is a great value. I would expect to pay more for a monocular of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: wkwngr

customer_reviews.title: Compact, quality scope that delivers.
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this scope. It's compact, feels good in the hands and seems very well built. I looked at quite a few options but settled on Roxant for the price, value and ratings. In the past I have owned some monoculars that had a very narrow view or were not all that clear. These have a nice field of vision and clear view. I use an old fashioned compass to chart hiking paths well off the beaten path. I find using a monocular easier to create regular LOS points and take in the overall terrain better.
customer_reviews.author: Del Cabon

customer_reviews.title: Useless, in fact I totally forgot about it.
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless that I totally forgot about it until I was checking all my past orders year later, May 2020. I bought the product back in April 2019 and played with a few times and then, forgot about it. Luckily I still have the monocular, but still without any clues why I even bought it first place. Yes, it doesn't have any magnification. No difference between your plain eye sight and with the monocular.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scope
customer_reviews.text: Grip scope is awesome. Solid and well built. I just received it today and have already used it. Worked out perfect. I am using it for target practice to see my shots at 25 to 50 yards. Most Scopes that I have tried have way too much magnification and are very hard to hold still enough to see where you hit. This scope had great reviews on Amazon so I thought I'd give it a shot and I am very happy with it. Just the right amount of magnification to see at 25 to 50 yards without being too shaky.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money...because it's inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave this a 4 star rating isn't so much for the quality or features of this product but because for what I paid, and it does okay. Could it be better? Yup. But it works, not as good as I would like it. But like I said, I didn't pay much. Would I pay more for a better product with better features? Yup. It is what it is. So take the 4 star rating for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian Iron

customer_reviews.title: Borderline novelty scope. Buy something better.
customer_reviews.text: I can almost see as well with my plain eyes as I can with this scope. It honestly does not come close to 6X magnification. Worthless purchase just to have a scope that looks expensive so you can look like you know what you are doing outdoors to other people who don't know it's doing virtually nothing to help you see better. Return started. looking for something better. I'm figuring the sub $100 range is still reasonable for a good scope, just not the $40-$50 range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Horrible Case!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the scope for my daughter. She uses it for Olympic Recurve Archery practice. It is a popular scope at her archery school. It is well made. She wears glasses, so we like the adjustable eye cup and big lens. The scope is also very bright for her indoor shoots. We purchased from amazon. The scope arrived promptly and without damage. The design of the scope is good and feels good in the hands. The price is good for the quality. UPDATE: it’s a great shoot, but the case is garbage. It already tore after only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm legally blind veteran, having only 10% vision in my right eye. I have no peripheral vision. The scope works great for the eye, not only giving me magnification but enhances the light and increases my scope of vision. The quality of material and workmanship is excellent. The price cannot be beat in this category of products. Ease of use is unsurpassed in any other product I've tried to use. This product has enhanced my quality of life and I would highly recommend it for anyone with similar vision problems
customer_reviews.author: leather72

customer_reviews.title: Great fir kids, too
customer_reviews.text: Our nine year old son loves to use this scope for looking in our yard and across the fields at wildlife and farmers plowing and harvesting. He likes to take it when we go hiking or to parks as well. The pound and neck string are handy! He can use them with or without his glasses. Both the focus and the zoom rings are easy for him to use. Instructions were clear and easy to follow. Our seven year old now is working to save money to buy his own scope, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved my order of the Grip Scope today. So far, I like the product! I plan to use it around the house to check out various game and animals on my property. I will either keep it in my truck for when I drive around or may look into the Blackbird as I am impressed with the optics on the Grip. It is lightweight, no "jittery" picture, and feels well built. I like it. I have one regret and that is that mine did not come with the neck/hand strap accessory that would be nice to have. Update: The kind folk at ROXANT are sending me a neck strap since it didn't come with one!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Maybe just what I am looking for (pardon my pun)
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot overseas to visit historic sites. I usually take a pair of binoculars to aid in viewing them but the binoculars can get cumbersome to carry/use. I am hoping that the grip scope will satisfy the majority of my needs. It seems to be right sized for my needs and the weight aspect is particularly good. It seems to be reasonably well built and fairly priced but I will know more after my next trip which will be to the mid-east (Egypt, Jordan, and Israel).
customer_reviews.author: Appaloosa

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and weight of the grip scope. I purchased it for my daughter and her husband because they are about to leave on an extended trip on their boat and also living in a motorhome for several years. It seemed perfect for their new lifestyle. They will be traveling in the Carribean and around the country. She is a photographer and I know this will help them in deciding where to pull in to port or decide where they might take a photography hike. The quality looks very good and I feel good about giving it as a gift. I haven’t given it to them yet. We received it in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Zarate

customer_reviews.title: Solid but not the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ok - I’m going to risk the wrath of some of the reviewers here but I returned my item. Folks it’s simply overpriced. I purchased another item with a larger lens which gathered more light, greater zoom, and much less money. I do support American small businesses but I couldn’t justify this purchase. Yes it’s solid and small so it’s easy to carry. It doesn’t magnify much but it’s optics are clear. It’s just not the best solution if you are looking for a closer sight picture for the money in my opinion. Best regards.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at the clearity and sharpness of focus
customer_reviews.text: I am a criminal investigatot. I use the ROXANT SCOPE for surveillance, in the vehicle and on foot. I use several cover tatics to hide the scope. When i am in a restaurant or on foot. Once you have dialed in the scope your done. I have used over the years many scopes in the field. I was amazed at the clearity and sharpness of focus. Roxant also makes a Spotting Scope, which i am anioxus to try. For long range surveillance, this scope may turn out to do the job well. I will update this review as i gain more experence with both scopes, in the field. Sincerely, John Hancock Cfkmlnal Investigations Metro
customer_reviews.author: John Hancock / Metro Intelligence Criminal Investigations

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bird watching
customer_reviews.text: I love the Grip Scope that I received so quickly last week. I am using the scope to get a closer look at birds visiting my bird feeders and the pond near our house. I chose the monocular scope because it is seemed like it would be easier to use than binoculars, especially after reading some of the positive reviews for this product. It is the perfect size and comes with a case and a lens cloth... I keep it near my kitchen window. It gives me a nice clear picture. I would recommend this scope because it is priced right and does exactly what I needed it for... enjoying a good view of the birds.
customer_reviews.author: FaithVgl

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The Grip Scope is very well made. The weather resistant rubber-like coating will be important during outside use. In addition it will provide some protective measure in the event of a drop. The size is perfect for my use. Maybe just a little large for convenient pocket carry (but that is where the mini scope will come in handy). If you don't really need the full capability of carrying around a set of binoculars the Grip Scope is a great,alternative. The field of view of the 6x30 lens is great. I don't mind giving up a small measure of power to enjoy a wider viewing area. And the optics are bright and clear.
customer_reviews.author: JimTC

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scope!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this grip scope for use while fly fishing. So many times while on the river I’ve spotted wildlife in the distance and wished I had a better way to view. I’m interested in attempting some cell phone photography through the lens as well. While I haven’t had the opportunity to test the scope out while fishing I took it on a short hike around the neighborhood and I am very happy with what I have seen so far. The scope was delivered swiftly as promised. The quality to price ratio is, in my opinion, enormous- I look forward to bringing my new companion on many future adventures!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great scope - highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the Roxant Scope. I rated 5 Stars on Amazon and highly recommend your product. I will use this scope at my campsite and trail walks. The Grip Scope is very solidly built and is the perfect size and weight for purpose I bought it. Price of scope is very reasonable. Product was delivered in perfect condition and was well packaged. Can’t think of any improvements. Will highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Landon

customer_reviews.title: Loving This
customer_reviews.text: I received the Grip Scope a few days ago and am already loving it. The optics are quite clear and it is easy to focus. I also like how small it is which makes it easy to put on my belt and take with me while I am working. I work as a Home Inspector and have this on my belt all day long. I can easily pull the Grip Scope out and look at things that are hard for me to access such as roofs, fireplaces and the like. This product will really help me see defects that need to be reported to my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Kim McCulley

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The monoscope feels solid and well built. Amazon delivered better than expected. Like the design, the wide view the shape and size. Feels good in hand. Easy to hold. Nice to view through one-eyed as opposed to using a binocular. Right now, using the monoscope for bird watching. Plan to use and take with me when traveling or attending concerts, opera, etc. Very satisfied customer. Gave one star for night vision because the monoscope purchased is not designed for night vision. Did not buy the monoscope to use at night.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for my dad.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roxant Grip Scope as a present for my father. He owns a large patch of wood next to his home in Missouri and though he doesn't hunt it any more, he likes to ride through it on his quad bike and watch for deer and other animals he used to hunt. He always used these large old binoculars he kept on the quad bike. He complained how heavy they were and how cumbersome it was to get them out or keep them around his neck. So I gave him this gift. He loves how easy the Roxant Grip Scope is to use and how much easier it is to carry and store.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Could be an isolated incident but... I’m not satisfied. I bought this to use on the golf course. The eyes aren’t what they use to be and I want something inexpensive to see distant objects from time to time. I bought it based solely on price and high reviews. The issue is the lack of focus. I thought it was my eyesight but others tried to use it and they couldn’t get it to focus. I will return the item, if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D.

customer_reviews.title: great scope to keep in the pickup to go boondocking
customer_reviews.text: I received this Grip Scope as a Christmas present from my wife. We went to the Caprock Canyons State Park here in the Texas Panhandle to look for buffalo. The scope works great while being compact and easy to carry and use one handed (had the leash for the dog in the other hand). Great product for the money! I cannot comment about the delivery time because it was a gift. I will keep this scope in mind if I need a gift for one of my adventurous young family members.
customer_reviews.author: Seano

customer_reviews.title: Scope works great and is reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with purchasing this grip scope.The package arrived on time and with no damage. We love the grip scope and were fighting over it. My son used it to watch his son's Football game, I used it for bird watching. We may order another one. Seems to be very well made.The grip is just right to hold steady and the focus is easy. The size is perfect, big enough,not awkward like binoculars. I like that it can be held in one hand when you have something in the other.
customer_reviews.author: Okay Veekay

customer_reviews.title: Recipient loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husbands birthday. He has taken it target shooting several times and loved it. He is now keeping in a chair side table drawer for quick and easy use when critters come through the yard. He is so happy with this that he wants a different model for Christmas! It is well made and feels and looks very expensive. He has enjoyed showing it and bragging about it to his friends.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution when you don't have or want to carry binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grip scope for my father, who has everything and needs nothing, and it was perfect! He really likes it. I really like it. I am fairly ignorant to all things outdoors (except snowboarding), however I loved how straight-forward it is to use and I particularly appreciated the retractable eyepiece. This seems like a perfect address to varying eyelash lengths. Most importantly, he loved it and that equates to me that it is well-built and the perfect size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: DLC4123

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new scope. I'm older and somewhat housebound, but we feed the birds, squirrels, bunnies and sometimes a raccoon. The scope enables me to get a closer view of our little menagerie and I really enjoy seeing the little personalities in our group of small critters. The scope is just the right size for me and very easy to use. It's a very quality product and came packaged in great shape. Definitely a good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Habib

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant GRIP SCOPE and the Roxant MINI scope are great scopes for the money. We got ours after spending the day whale watching on the back deck. Wife had camera with zoom lens and I had standard binoculars. We both got arm weary real fast so I got the Grip Scope. It's perfect for our needs. Light weight yet well built. Focus ring is easy to use. Nice lanyard keeps it handy. Very good picture/view quality. Highly recommend the Roxant scopes. Great customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: cueball9

customer_reviews.title: NOT a cheap "spyglass".
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that this is not, nor does it claim to be, a super-magnifying monocular. It IS a precision spotting device that has a wider viewing range and VERY clear optics. In other words, instead of viewing something through a jittery pin-hole, the Grip Scope gives a clear and wide optical experience. It's easy to hold, the focus is very precise, and yo can actually see movement and peripheral objects.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and clear vision
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Grip Scope from Roxant and am extremely satisfied with it. Easy to hold and adjust when needed. Eye piece is excellent. I had a wonderful clear view of birds which was thoroughly enjoyable. The scope itself is small enough to put in my handbag and I love the carrying case. The price was right!!! Would recommend this seller and their products. The description was true to what I received and the warranty extended when registered.
customer_reviews.author: lyn

customer_reviews.title: A great "Goldilocks" monoscope... not too big and not too small but just right!
customer_reviews.text: I do like my Grip Scope! I have been using it for birdwatching and starting in September, I will be taking it to Notre Dame football games. I had been taking binoculars but the Grip Scope will be more portable and serve my needs well. The quality is excellent both in construction and optics . I especially like the way it feels in my hand.... solid and comfortable with the rubberized exterior. And the size is right. Whoever designed this knew optical physics. For the modest cost it is a real value. I am sure I will enjoy it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: slyfox

customer_reviews.title: Great Optics
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it so as to have a low cost device in my car in order to look at distant objects and wildlife. I wanted it as a companion to the Roxant Pocket Mini Scope that I carry in my pocket. Having seen the quality and great optics of the Mini Scope, I was inspired to buy the larger scope. To me the most impressive feature is the optical quality. There is no perceptible distortion and the distant image is quite clear. The outer case of the scope appears rugged and would offer protection from drops. The only criticism that I would offer is that the focus ring is stiff. This may simply be because the device is new.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Faris

customer_reviews.title: Well done, aquality instrument at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grip scope several weeks ago and used hiking at Barr Lake in Colorado. The eagle migration is there now and we spotted many bald eagles in their various maturation stages. Swainson Hawks and Red tailed hawks were also plentiful. The grip scope was light around my neck and allowed me to quickly sight the birds because of its wide field of view, more quickly than my binocular sporting buddies. Because of the birds proximity the 6x magnification gave me great detail that was sharp and clear. I really like this optic and plan to take it on all my hikes as opposed to my heavy binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Best quality at an amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: So you know when something sounds too good to be true? Well I decided to try this product and I am so glad that I did. It is beautifully made very accurate and super easy to use. I really like the size and weight of this product combined with its high-quality lens. No longer do I need a heavy set of binoculars or expensive new ones. This is a gift that everyone would love!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and field of vision
customer_reviews.text: The scope has good size, easy to hold. I have had others, and this one appears to be very well built. Very solid and easy to grip. This scope provides a much wider view than my previous scope and is easier to hold, less bulky. This should be a perfect size and shape for my needs. It’s also less expensive than my previous and seems a much better product. use this scope on my sailboat (easy to use with one hand and steer with the other), for hunting, for whale watching.
customer_reviews.author: Karaj

customer_reviews.title: Great Monocular Scope
customer_reviews.text: I love this scope! The size is manageable for a monocular, and the weight of the scope is well-balanced throughout. I have a visual impairment, and have used a variety of monocular telescopes with mixed results. The Grip Scope's optics are terrific-very bright and crisp, and focusing is easy, though it takes two hands to do it well. I really like the power of the scope, and especially the wider field of vision. My children both participate in sports, and this scope had worked very well in viewing college lacrosse so far this year. Amazing price considering the high quality of this scope. I would highly recommend this scope for sports viewing, lectures and even general mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gookin

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope
customer_reviews.text: This is my first grip scope; I purchased it to use nature watching. I have a place in Florida and we can visit many parks and preserves along the west coast. While I like my big binoculars, they are bulky and heavy. This is perfect to keep in my pocket or small pack, light weight and very good optics. I like the focus ring and ability to use with or without glasses. The carry strap is a plus, in addition to the pouch. I have no complaints and would purchase this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Quality bargain 6x30 Monocular
customer_reviews.text: 5 Star reviews were right. I tried it at night where I have experience. Stars form pinpoints across the view showing no false color. When you scan a star or planet from side to side, the field is flat, not curved barrel-like. Mars has its true orange hue and Vega shows it’s bit of bluish white. Fine and true color rendition. The moon craters are sharp and the seas show very well. A 6x30 has an edge for low light viewing with its 5mm exit pupil so performance notes around darkness are useful. This is a great lower power monocular for anytime, and is a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Tim happy popper

customer_reviews.title: This scope is sturdy, well constructed and has great optics
customer_reviews.text: This scope is sturdy, well constructed and has great optics. It replaces binoculars we use to watch the birds feeding at our bird feeder about 30 feet from the house. The eye relief is the big reason this scope was in my final two choices because I wear glasses ans my wife doesn't. With a quick adjustment no black crescents when either of us use the scope. Wife has 10X Leupold binoculars but for this distance the Roxant leaves a free hand to hold the morning coffee and still no quiver in the field of view.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband for when we go whale watching in the San Juan Islands this May to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. I haven’t really used it to its full potential yet, but from what I found out from testing it is that it will be perfect for our needs. It’s husky, but very convenient and not too heavy. The magnification is perfect for birding, whale watching, and general snooping! I think he will be surprised and pleased. It’s also much easier to use than traditional binoculars and so easy to put in the pocket of a day pack. The price was right for the the job it does.
customer_reviews.author: Gail S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: It was a great help for these old eyes
customer_reviews.text: I've only gotten to use the scope a little this Memorial Day weekend. On Saturday, my nephew and I used it as a target shooting spotting scope. We weren't at long distance rifle range, but were able to successfully spot .22 caliber holes at about 70 ft. or so. It was a great help for these old eyes. Around the house, I've used it to watch birds around our feeders. The image is bright and pretty clear for such a small instrument. It's best features are its size and reasonably good optics. I originally purchased this as a gift for my father-in-law, but may have to keep this one. The device is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Drennen

customer_reviews.title: Great image, light-weight, easy to c arry when biking
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this. It is light-weight and compact. The image is large and quite bright.... I have no imperfections or distortions. I take this when biking, primarily for watching birds or planes, and boats when by the river. I would have preferred a bit more power, maybe an 8x, but this as close to perfect as you can get, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great size, power, and clarity.
customer_reviews.text: This has been on my Amazon wishlist for several months and ordered it yesterday. It is reasonably priced, so I am not sure why I waited until now to order it. I had researched the reviews and this one outshone the others. I just received my Roxant Grip scope today and already have been watching the mountain bluebirds in our bottom pasture. I mainly purchased this for wildlife viewing while hiking. It is the perfect size for a backpack. I am already thinking about purchasing these for Christmas gifts for our kids. I am impressed with the power and clarity. I love that it can be used while keeping my glasses on. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Buy with Confidence!
customer_reviews.text: This scope is EXCELLENT! Sharp, Clear to the edges, easy to hold. Depth of field is good too. For the price you can beat it. If there is anything on the slightly negative side is the stiffness of the focus ring. It's a little difficult to focus smoothly. On the other side you don't want it to be too easy either. That is in no way a reason not to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rickford

customer_reviews.title: Great buy at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roxant Grip Scope as a birthday gift for my brother. He works on a large site and I thought it would be great for him to use at work. Well I was right. He absolutely loves it and told me he takes it with him every day in it's neat carry case. He's able to stand at one spot and look at what the workers are doing in another section of the site without having to drive or walk over there. It's small and neat yet sturdy and works very well. I am definitely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Ill be buying more from this company.
customer_reviews.text: The Grip Scope arrived from amazon quickly and well packed, in perfect shape. I bought it for two things, spotting targets while shooting and, more importantly, to take with me while hiking to aid in navigation and to see terrain. It appears to be well made and sturdy. It is easy to use. The field of view is good for 6x. I believe it will suit my purposes quite well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight monocular.
customer_reviews.text: I love this wide view monocular.It is just what I was looking for to nature watch while walking. It is lightweight which is an important feature for me as I tire easily. It gives a really clear view and the added feature of the retractable eyepiece is great when I need to wear my glasses. I have been telling my friends and family how much I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle Benge

customer_reviews.title: is the perfect size for the purpose
customer_reviews.text: After comparing the different handheld monoculars, I bought the Grip Scope because it has the right magnification for hand held use, is the perfect size for the purpose, and build quality is excellent. Optics are high quality and coated for good light transmission, and I particularly like the tactile rubber surface which makes it easy to hold and has a good 'feel' to it. I don't need the adjustable eyepiece as I don't wear glasses, but it is a good feature for those who do. I really don't have any cons to offer for this scope, and so the 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: Love the design
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. I'm going to use this as a spotting scope and it looks very professional. Feels perfect in my hand and is easy to adjust. Size is great. I have medium hands and didn't feel too big or small. Quality of build is very solid. I'm very picky and saw no visual defects. I was satisfied with the price and I bought this for myself. Like I said, I will be using this as a spotting scope during target practice and can't wait to use it at the range! I really appreciate form, fit and function and this nails all three! Thank you Roxant!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi Purpose Tool
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy I purchased this Roxant Grip Scope. The price is right for this solid built monocular. Well made and ready to help my dad who suffers from declining vision, it has given him renewed experiences going to the beach by helping him see what’s happening on the sand and surf. My husband and I have also found it helpful looking at some of our roof tiles after a recent hurricane - checking them to make sure things are ok. It’s an awesome multi-use tool!
customer_reviews.author: MAStopyra

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that this scope is very user friendly for my father, age 73,
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the grip scope for my father's birthday, and I must say it was a hit! Everyone wants to have a look see! My father is using it to keep an eye on his bird feeders, deer and squirrels. The design is very nice, simple, and portable, and it includes a protective sleeve. It feels like a quality built product. It is very lightweight, even when using the lanyard. The clarity of the range is awesome! I love the fact that this scope is very user friendly for my father, age 73. He loves it (I do too!), and said the clarity is superb, and is very useful on his large farm. Keep making great quality products!
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Denise

customer_reviews.title: Both are excellent. Used the large for watching the sidelines during ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the hand grip and mini. Both are excellent. Used the large for watching the sidelines during football game. Surprisingly excellent optics for the price and size. Smaller one I've used less but it goes everywhere with me in the vehicle as it is tiny. Works well. Will use for inspecting buildings and construction sites from the street. And of course bird and wildlife. Grip scope is at home near window where we watch birds. Smaller scope works great. As a gift the small scope is a no brainer and I'll stuff a few stockings with them. The larger scope is a nice gift for the enthusiast more likely. Price on both is excellent .
customer_reviews.author: Raul Enrique

customer_reviews.title: A compact scope that is convenient to carry
customer_reviews.text: I was delighted to receive the Grip Scope as a gift. It is easy to use, compact and very convenient to carry in the pouch. The image is very clear. So far I have used it while walking on the beach to view the boats in the bay and the shore birds at the water's edge that are beginning to move along the shore in the annual winter migration. I intend to have the Scope with me whenever I walk or hike outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Aisling french

customer_reviews.title: excellent gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Roxant Grip Scope for my son who is traveling to Germany for Christmas and thought he would enjoy it for his travel adventure. I love ordering product from Amazon. It came quickly (2 days), safely and they let me know it was coming and delivered. They are very good, unlike other on line businesses... I am happy with the purchase and it seemed reasonably priced and now I hope my son loves his gift. i think he will. The design is unique and if it works as well as advertised it should be outstanding..and very good for traveling
customer_reviews.author: LAWRENCE T. GORSKI

customer_reviews.title: Quality optics for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I am using it for archery deer hunting and I don't need a high power unit but I do need the best clarity I can get. This is the one. Compact and easy to adjust the focus. It even arrived a day earlier than expected. The long eye relief helps to not fog the lenses from my breath on cool mornings. I will recommend this product to others. Keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Currier

customer_reviews.title: Looks like quality made product
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Roxant Grip Scope today. This is a very professional looking and feeling, quality made product. It was also packaged very well and suffered no damage in shipping. My wife and I kayak and she recently said she would like a monocular so she can see the eagles, herons and egrets where we explore at Presque Isle, on Lake Erie in Erie, PA. I am looking forward to her face when she sees this! It is also lightweight enough to easily hang from the neck lanyard.
customer_reviews.author: K Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this monocular. Just like a few reviews stated, one must hold the eyepiece about 1/2" away from the eye (with the eyepiece extended) to see clearly. Otherwise you see a very large black ring that produces a tunnel vision effect. To see steady you'll need two hands. This unit would have been so much better if the eyepiece came out another half inch.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I just received the grip scope. Based on my preliminary usage, I find it to be a very good value for a well made product. It's for general use and the optics seem to be high quality. it is built sturdy and I think it will hold up well. I bought it for myself and will use it for general viewing in landscapes and national parks. The only possible improvement I can think of is to have protective covers for the lenses that are attached to the body so they don't get lost. All in all a very good product. The company appears to be going out of its way to learn and adapt to customer demands.
customer_reviews.author: Scott F.

customer_reviews.title: The optics are super clear and a wide field of view
customer_reviews.text: This monocular is much more than I had hoped for. The optics are super clear and a wide field of view. An outstanding scope for the money. I could not be more pleased with this purchase. I have tried others but this one has a very high definition that one would expect in a higher priced monocular. If you are needing a light weight quality monocular this is a good one to try. This goes in my GHB (Get Home Bag).
customer_reviews.author: To the Right of Attila  the Hun

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Scope
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant monocular was a present for my boyfriend who works as a railroad engineer. As part of his job a monocular (or binoculars) are an absolute necessity to see down the rail ahead of the train. He had a different brand monocular which worked effectively until he lost it on a recent trip. This scope was a replacement. He really, really liked this brand so much more than the other scope. He said it had awesome magnification even at night, wasn't too heavy and arrived in a timely fashion as well. I think it was a great value in comparison with other monoculars on the market. Also, it’s truly "refreshing" to receive such great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: its tempting to say that this is a great product for the price. in truth, its a great product, period. great glass. very pleased. would buy again in a hot minute. (if you purchase, read the instructions. i mean, its a monocular, what instructions do you need? i didn't notice the retractable eye cup in my first uses....then i saw the paper...that came with the monocular. )
customer_reviews.author: Lou wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for golfing and more.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Grip Scope to use while golfing so I can look ahead at the hole I’m playing and where I want to land my shot. The scope is light weight and feels very solid. It adjusts easily and fits easily into pockets on my golf bag. I can see numerous other uses for this scope and will use it for other sporting events I’m sure. It works well and for the price I don’t see how you can beat the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Scope feels substantial in your hand
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Scope feels substantial in your hand; especially at this price point. The form factor/size feels just right. From the moment I grabbed it, I knew it was a quality product. I like that you can carry the scope on your hip by running your belt through the loop on the case. Also comes with a cloth and optional wrist strap. Compared to binoculars, I was surprised how much less effort/space/heft is needed when hiking to get the same effect using the Roxant Grip Scope. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I like your scope mostly for its compact size and ease to stick in my pocket. I bring it when I walk local trails for bird spotting and fish rises in the local bass pond. It is quite easy to find what I'm looking for due to the wide field and once it's adjusted for my eye (my wife uses it also) there is no more fiddling with focus. I wear eyeglasses and I find that if I adjust the rubber cowling out just a bit I can raise the scope right to my glasses and get immediate vision through it. One thing I wish it had is a tethered lens cover.
customer_reviews.author: David J Kingfish

customer_reviews.title: Their parents will be able to hold them up and the children will Still be able to hold on to their parents with one arm and use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these monocular for my grandchildren. Ages 10 and 8 both girls for a trip in august to Alaska. They will be using them on ship. As children are never tall enough to see things. Their parents will be able to hold them up and the children will Still be able to hold on to their parents with one arm and use the Monocular with the other to see so many wonderful things. They have been practicing using them the day they got them. One daughter has glasses so the long eye relief and cup will be A blessing to her so she will be able to see all the wild life
customer_reviews.author: Best Deals

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, I cant believe the quality for the price..
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding image quality, bright and clear through the entire image field. Eye relief is excellent as well. Turn up/down eye cup work excellent - focus was a little tight at first, but seems to be improving. I also have a set of Wind River (Leupold/imported) binoculars, and the quality is on par with them ($150+). I am wondering if this is the same manufacturer as them, but the quality is outstanding either way. Will absolutely buy another one down the road..
customer_reviews.author: Jef F

customer_reviews.title: low magnification
customer_reviews.text: Have 3 older rifle scopes to compare magnification: a 2X. a 4X and a 6X p0wer. The Roxant is only slightly more powerful than the 2X. Very disappointing. Issues with eye relief (distance from eye to eye piece) being to far also. If you buy you will be sending back or passing on to your grandkids as a stocking stuffer.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction - feels solid. Focusing ring is a little stiff, which might be a good thing as it will probably loosen-up with use. Size is compact but might be a little too large to carry in a pocket. I originally bought it for target sighting; however, the magnification level is not well-suited for that purpose at distances greater than 25 yards. Using a hand-held monocular requires a steadier hand than with binoculars, which is something that I did not anticipate. A little pricey, but overall I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaketh

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift for someone who's hard to buy for.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Roxant Wide View Monocular! Christmas gift for my husband - something he doesn't have and I know he will be using a lot - very excited to find it. It's well built, has a very solid feel, easy to hold and a great price! Plan to get one for myself next and keep it in the car (love to check out the wildlife when we are out for a drive).
customer_reviews.author: ABrewerSmith

customer_reviews.title: Great Device! Would definitely recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.text: My Roxant Grip Scope just came today. Although the instructions are brief, it really does help to read them. I wasn't seeing well through the scope until I pulled out the retractable eyepiece. That made ALL the difference. I plan to use in Alaska on the Kenai Peninsula and Lake Clark bear watching. Will also use in float trip seeking wildlife. I never could use binoculars so this is the answer for me. The scope is easy to use, easy to grip and hold steady, and the lanyard gives that safety factor for those of us who have a tendency toward being a klutz. I love the carrying case which can be attached to a belt or to a carabiner.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I received the Roxant Grip Scope quickly and securely just days after I placed my order. I ordered it for my husband who is legally blind in one eye, I thought this would take up less room in his bag while deer hunting in the mountains of Virginia. My husband was so excited and loved the feel of it. He immediately went out to start looking through it, he was very pleased with the product and can’t wait to get on the stand with it! We would definitely recommend this monocular with its high definition wide view and at such an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Landry

customer_reviews.title: Very happy woth scope!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the grip scope to spot targets at 25-50yds and it works well for that. I also have a great view from my 22nd floor office and found that I can see much clearer through the grip scope than the 10x30 binoculars we have there. It helps to have some magnification to check out interesting planes at the downtown airport or see how the traffic on the highway looks. Overall I'm really impressed with the build quality and how bright and clear the images look through the scope. I bought it based on the reviews on amazon saying that it was a quality product and a good value and I agree.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this lottle scope
customer_reviews.text: I really like the new grip scope that I just recieved, it fits the hand just right. I like how easy it is to use. I like how small it is and yet it brings great detail to far away things. I like to target shoot and this will be a fun addition to my range bag to help me zero in on my targets! Thanks for a good scope at a really fair price!
customer_reviews.author: Jbeck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am actually very happy with the scope I purchased and the size is perfect and the magnifying lenses is exactly what I wanted. The other scopes I looked at were too strong of magnification so this Roxant was just right. I would definitely recommend this product. You can even cut and paste it if you like.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Review

customer_reviews.title: how awesome it is
customer_reviews.text: we bought 2 so we didnt have to share! i HAVE always had issues trying to see out of binaculars and scopes. that is until we received the GRIP SCOPE. i used it yesterday to see the fall colors changing on the mountain behind our home. i was totally happy to finally use the GRIP SCOPE and be able to see through it clearly. i even used it with and without my glasses. i am amazed. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU FOR THIS GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does feel like a quality build
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pocket scope for myself. When I travel I always carry a go bag with items I might need if i am stuck somewhere. I needed a scope or binoculars to complete it and with space at premium, I decided to go with a small scope.While reading different reviews I came across your product and ordered it. It does feel like a quality build. The operation with the focus ring is straight forward and the retractable eyepiece is a nice touch. Being retractable I don't worry about it cracking like the fold over ones found on a lot of similar products. The view through it is very clear and is just the right magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Miller

customer_reviews.title: The best feature is the compact size and the clarity
customer_reviews.text: This scope feels solid and durable. The best feature is the compact size and the clarity. It took me a minute or two to figure out how to find the focus because of how it blends into the shaft. I initially thought the texture to the focus ring was simply for grip. The shape is streamline and compact. Perfect for our multi-use purposes.My Wife and I don't have large hands so it is comfortable but not too small. The price is great and I have suggested it to a few others because of the quality. We love the outdoors. So, it will be used for Hiking, Travel, and spotting target hits at the range. Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: musclenergy

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The Grip Scope is great: powerful, easy to use, solid, and real portable. And I like that the strap is meant to be worn around the neck. (I don’t see the point of having a monocular on my wrist.) Anyway, I’m glad I bought it; a good product at a good price. My only “concern” at this point is that the focus ring is a bit hard to turn. However, this is a very minor concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Optics for the Birder not survivalist
customer_reviews.text: The roxant grip scope i got was slightly damaged. The eyepiece had a small but noticeable cut into the rubbery material. The optics were really impressive but QC issues made me return it. The bottom line...I do not believe it could survive the rigors i would put in through in the mountains of Mt Shasta. For a birder it would be a treat.
customer_reviews.author: lanmo

customer_reviews.title: Roxant Grip Scope
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a visual impairment and the optics in her glasses have extremely strong prisms. The prisms prevent her from using regular binoculars. Unless we are close to the stage, plays and concerts can be difficult. I was hoping the Grip Scope with its wider viewing range would help. We have an outdoor venue near our home that, due to Covid-19, has not been open. We were able to view the stage from the "cheap seats" and the Grip Scope worked great. The image was crystal clear and definitely magnified. The field of vision was still wide enough to see part of the stage and not just watching one performer.
customer_reviews.author: David C Dudik

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive & useful monocular scope
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a gift for my son, I truly believe that he will enjoy using it for closeup images that will interest him. I had a friend carefully examine this piece and he gave it a big thumbs up as to quality, its value. I think it can be more useful than standard binoculars, smaller is size, but serving the same purpose. As I examined it myself, I was pleased with its function. I give it my best recommendation, and think buyers will be satisfied with this product without a doubt
customer_reviews.author: Oksana Plesh

customer_reviews.title: Great little scope
customer_reviews.text: I received my Grip Scope on Monday. It's really nice. I like that I can use it with my glasses on. It just feels like a solid piece of equipment. The only quibble I have is that there are no protective end caps similar to what comes with the Evolution Binoculars. Aside from that very minor issue, the scope is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  - Perfect for birdwatching and other outdoor viewing
customer_reviews.text: This little scope is exactly what I wanted. It is easy to hold and not at all jittery. It's lightweight but still feels substantial, not cheaply made. I cannot use binoculars because I have astigmatism and can't focus properly (even with glasses on). This product works great with and without me wearing glasses and the soft rubber end won't scratch my plastic glasses lenses. The mechanisms to focus move smoothly yet aren't loose or flimsy - so it stays focused as you want it to be. Well packed and quickly shipped by Amazon. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: coffeegal

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The Roxant monocular scope is exactly what I was looking for, a high quality, durable product that is simple and easy to use. We live along an active river in Washington state with a lot of birds and wildlife going by we wanted to catch a clearer view of. In the past we have kept classic binoculars on hand, but found them difficult to use and focus with. This Roxant monocular makes scoping, locating, and focusing on items far easier – the image is sharp and steady right away. The monocular fits well in my hand and feels solid enough to last us a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: E. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: great scope for a person with low vision
customer_reviews.text: I really like the GRIP SCOPE. It is comfortable to hold and easy to adjust. It is a bit large to carry while walking, but it makes up for that with a wide visual field. All of my vision is in one eye, and that is very low. I have 20 over 300 with correction. I really like the fact that I can use the scope with my glasses. I use a monocular to read things like street signs and bus numbers. I believe that it will be useful at concerts and other events, especially if I have to sit any distance from the stage. Thanks again for a good product at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: deep waters

product_meta.title: Authentic ROXANT Grip Scope High Definition Wide View Monocular - with Retractable Eyepiece and Fully Multi Coated Optical Glass Lens + BAK4 Prism. Comes with Cleaning Cloth, Case & Neck Strap.
product_meta.description: This is our top of the line handheld wide view spotting scope featuring true 6 x 30 viewing. The monocular is compact and durable with high quality precision design featuring all glass high end optics. The scope is equipped with a no slip comfort molded grip which provides less shake so it’s very easy to hold steady with one hand. Our premium construction features high definition optical glass with premium fully multi coated All glass lens which guarantees superior light transmission and brightness for optimal bright, crisp, clear viewing. Understanding optics 101: most newbies figure more powerful is better. When it comes to handheld scopes, more powerful is not better. Why? The larger the magnification, The more shake and jitter you will have. So an ideal size for a small, handheld scope would be a 6x. Fact: although a magnification of 10, 12 or higher is available, 6x power scopes are easier to use and in most cases more practical. Without a tripod or telescope stand 6x will give you the best optical experience. This scope also adds 6 x30 wide view lens so you’ll be able to experience the whole panorama in crystal clear beauty. Unlike most scopes this size, ours features a retractable eyecup for use with or without eyeglasses. Accessories include a carry pouch with belt loop + cleaning cloth and neck strap. Ideal for: travel, concerts, outdoor activities, nature, bird watching, hunting, archery, target shooting, hiking, camping etc. Makes a great stocking stuffer!
feature_bullets: NO SLIP COMFORT MOLDED GRIP - Provides Less Shake - Very Easy To Hold Steady With One Hand - We’ve combined the best of comfort and functionality meaning you can comfortably hold them for long periods of time. Solidly built, yet lightweight for outdoorsman and adventure seekers.

SEE IN HIGH DEFINITION - Don't be fooled by Copycats. If it doesn’t say ROXANT on the side it’s not a ROXANT Scope. We use Optical Glass With Premium Fully Multi Coated, BAK4 Prism ALL Glass Lens guarantees superior light transmission and brightness for optimal bright, crisp, clear viewing. Seeing is Believing.
